meanings.definition: The act of placing a load or burden on something.
meanings.sent1: The loadings of heavy boxes strained his back.
meanings.sent2: She carried the loadings of groceries up the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The loadings of laundry seemed to multiply on their own.
meanings.sent4: The loadings of responsibilities weighed on her like a ton of bricks.
meanings.sent5: The loadings of books in his arms made him look like a walking library.

meanings.definition: The amount of work or responsibility that someone has.
meanings.sent1: His loadings at the office kept him busy all day.
meanings.sent2: The loadings of chores at home never seemed to end.
meanings.sent3: Juggling the loadings of school and sports was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The loadings of deadlines loomed over her like dark clouds.
meanings.sent5: The loadings of projects on his desk made it hard to find space for a cup of coffee.

meanings.definition: The process of adding a substance to another substance.
meanings.sent1: The loadings of sugar into the tea made it too sweet.
meanings.sent2: The loadings of paint onto the canvas created a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The loadings of spices in the soup gave it an unexpected kick.
meanings.sent4: The loadings of fuel into the car ensured a long journey ahead.
meanings.sent5: The loadings of toppings on the pizza made it a delicious treat.
